content: I am trying to implement _summary search parameter. The spec says that "This subset SHOULD consist solely of all supported elements that are marked as "summary" in the base definition of the resource(s)". Is there a way to grammatically decide which elements are summary elements? I worried if I hard coded adding summary elements (or removing non summary fields), that would break if the spec changes.
isSummary is declared as a property in the StructureDefinitions.
I know that. But I don't know how to get it in C#. Maybe I should move this topic to .net stream.
If you are using the FHIR .NET library there is an attribute specifying which property is part of the summary
